title: The Archive Verdict
outcome: Innovators leak confidential medical and audit records revealing Council complicity in Halden's mysterious death and subsequent data coverup. Vigils and public tribunals erupt, forcing the Council into defensive concessions. New rifts form as citizens question whether solidarity or accountability should define Stenograd’s future direction. Alliances shift and the city enters a reflective, volatile pause.

events.description: Redacted toxicology and audit logs related to Halden's death spread through free zone networks, sourced from an Innovator security breach.
Thousands gather in candlelit vigils while pop-up tribunals debate Council accountability for Halden’s demise and continued BCI secrecy.
Council urgent session divides on response: Directorate advocates for strict policing, Harmonists push silence, Innovators urge transparency to absorb public anger.
Council grants limited concessions: opening select records, issuing an apology, but avoids admitting wrongdoing. Trust remains low as citizens demand more.
Free zone meetings intensify, debating whether to focus on forgiveness or pursue further accountability. The city is riven with controversy, uncertainty, and new alliances.
